# (PART) RESOURCCES LINKS {-}

# Additional Resources & Useful Links {-}

This section gathers helpful tools, references, and links that support LMS integration of CDI Q&A materials. Use these to enhance your teaching setup, troubleshoot workflows, or connect with educator communities around open learning.

---

## 🌐 LMS Platform Guides {-}

| Platform               | Educator Docs / Support                                  |
|------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------|
| **Moodle**             | [https://docs.moodle.org/](https://docs.moodle.org/)  
| **Canvas**             | [https://community.canvaslms.com/](https://community.canvaslms.com/)  
| **Google Classroom**   | [https://edu.google.com/products/classroom/](https://edu.google.com/products/classroom/)  
| **Microsoft Teams EDU**| [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/education](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/education)

## 📁 Tools for Sharing & Collaboration {-}

- **GitHub Pages Hosting (CDI Guides)**  
  [https://complexdatainsights.com/explore-products](https://complexdatainsights.com/explore-products)

- **Google Colab (Run Python Notebooks)**  
  [https://colab.research.google.com](https://colab.research.google.com)

- **NBViewer (View GitHub-hosted notebooks)**  
  [https://nbviewer.org](https://nbviewer.org)

- **MyBinder (Launch `.ipynb` notebooks in browser)**  
  [https://mybinder.org](https://mybinder.org)

- **R Markdown + Pandoc (Convert Markdown to HTML/PDF)**  
  Tools like `rmarkdown::render()` and `pandoc` can generate web-friendly or printable formats — though CDI encourages online-first delivery.

> 📎 Reminder: CDI guides are best delivered via **live web links**.  
> If students need a static copy, they can use **Print → Save as PDF** from their browser.
